channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What you need to know about the healthcare subsidies at the heart of the shutdown
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with KFF Health News' Chief Washington Correspondent Julie Rovner about the healthcare subsidies at the center of the government shutdown.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with KFF Health News' Chief Washington Correspondent Julie Rovner about the healthcare subsidies at the center of the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: New Hampshire Sen. Jeanne Shaheen on where negotiations to end the shutdown stand
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin interviews Democratic Sen. Jeanne Shaheen of New Hampshire about the state of negotiations in Congress to end the government shutdown.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin interviews Democratic Sen. Jeanne Shaheen of New Hampshire about the state of negotiations in Congress to end the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Illinois AG responds to Trump's push to send National Guard to Chicago
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Illinois Attorney General Kwame Raoul about President Trump's efforts to deploy National Guard forces to Chicago, over state and local objections.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Illinois Attorney General Kwame Raoul about President Trump's efforts to deploy National Guard forces to Chicago, over state and local objections.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Supreme Court weighs conversion therapy in case from Colorado
item.description: The case pits conservative Christian groups against the LGBTQ community.
item.content:encoded:
The case pits conservative Christian groups against the LGBTQ community.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Trump's power to deploy National Guard, explained
item.description: President Trump is bucking tradition and legal precedent in pushing to deploy the National Guard to Democratic-led cities like Portland, Oregon, and Chicago due to what he says is rampant crime and to support his crackdown on illegal immigration.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is bucking tradition and legal precedent in pushing to deploy the National Guard to Democratic-led cities like Portland, Oregon, and Chicago due to what he says is rampant crime and to support his crackdown on illegal immigration.

(Image credit: Jim Vondruska)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump continues to push for National Guard deployments in U.S. cities, Tuesday marks two years since the start of the war in Gaza, SCOTUS to hear case challenging Colorado's conversion therapy ban.
item.content:encoded: Trump continues to push for National Guard deployments in U.S. cities, Tuesday marks two years since the start of the war in Gaza, SCOTUS to hear case challenging Colorado's conversion therapy ban.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Held hostage in Gaza for 491 days, an Israeli man recalls how he survived in new book
item.description: Eli Sharabi survived 491 days in Hamas captivity in Gaza following the Oct. 7, 2023 attack. Sharabi speaks with NPR's Leila Fadel about his book, "Hostage."
item.content:encoded: Eli Sharabi survived 491 days in Hamas captivity in Gaza following the Oct. 7, 2023 attack. Sharabi speaks with NPR's Leila Fadel about his book, "Hostage."
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Attorney General Pam Bondi to testify before Congress
item.description: Attorney General Pam Bondi will testify before Congress Tuesday. The hearing comes as concerns the Justice Department is being weaponized to target President Trump's political adversaries grow.
item.content:encoded: Attorney General Pam Bondi will testify before Congress Tuesday. The hearing comes as concerns the Justice Department is being weaponized to target President Trump's political adversaries grow.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: First privately funded uranium enrichment plant in U.S. to be built in Kentucky
item.description: A California-based firm plans to build the first privately funded uranium enrichment plant in Kentucky amid efforts to bolster the country's domestic uranium enrichment.
item.content:encoded: A California-based firm plans to build the first privately funded uranium enrichment plant in Kentucky amid efforts to bolster the country's domestic uranium enrichment.
item.dc:creator: Derek Operle

item.title: More college students are using AI for class. Their professors aren't far behind
item.description: More college students are using AI chatbots to help them with their studies. But data recently released by an AI company shows they're aren't the only ones using the technology.
item.content:encoded: More college students are using AI chatbots to help them with their studies. But data recently released by an AI company shows they're aren't the only ones using the technology.
